meanings.definition: To sweeten or make more palatable.
meanings.sent1: She edulcorates her tea with a spoonful of honey.
meanings.sent2: The chef edulcorates the dessert with a sprinkle of powdered sugar.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they watched the sugar edulcorate the bitter coffee.
meanings.sent4: Kindness can edulcorate even the sourest of hearts.
meanings.sent5: The sun's warm rays edulcorate the chilly morning air.

meanings.definition: To make less harsh or severe.
meanings.sent1: Adding cream can edulcorate the bitterness of black coffee.
meanings.sent2: The apology edulcorated the tension between them.
meanings.sent3: His joke edulcorated the seriousness of the meeting.
meanings.sent4: A smile can edulcorate a difficult situation.
meanings.sent5: Laughter has the power to edulcorate a gloomy day.
